Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Where is the sauce look really closely you might see some,maybe

grmcMEqKnYnlIts5KSBYYQ.text: I posted a photo of the Shrimp Diablo which was excellent.  It was suggested by the server after he persuaded me not to order the Lasagnas.  I really appreciate honesty from a server. In a place with 50+ items on the menu, there's bound to be some duds and stars. For the price, I was pleasantly surprised to see 6 decent-sized shrimp on the plate.  The Diablo was no joke. Slightly spicy to start, building slowly.    With a sandwich, I preferred the house-made chips over the sweet potato fries as the side.    If you order the garlic bread appetizer, I highly suggest adding the cheese.  Not a place to go if you're counting or reducing carbs. Seriously, the Chicken Parm entre is 2200 calories and they serve the Baked Pasta in a bread bowl.    Go here if you want to go big at not-so-big prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp Diablo was excellent.  I asked the server which Lasagna I should choose and he was brutally honest. &#34;NONE OF THEM.&#34; Good advice.

PsUBgIWc4p37Xta3F3EaeA.text: The food was ok. I ordered the Lady Scampi which was described to have 12 large shrimp with noodles.  There were only 6 and the portion of noodles could have served 4 people.  I was very disappointed.  But the dish was good.   I just had to leave most of the pasta because who wants to eat a boat of pasta for lunch?   My family ordered the thin pizza with two meat toppings as their second choice because their pan pizza would have taken 45 minutes.  We should have just ordered that because our food took about that long to come out. But it was because it sat under the warmer for a while.  I watched it sit there wondering why food would sit for so long and then I see our server pick it up and delivery it to us.  The kids,  who will eat just about any pizza did not like it and we ended up having to eat at jack in the box later because they were still hungry.   Our server was very nice though.   The Bollo sausage and the two apps we ordered (fried zuchinni and garlic bread) were good.  The sausage I really liked.  Or was very flavorful and spicy.   There was not much room for our group of 5 so we had to sit in a booth and add a chair.  Found out there's another building across the patio that may have been better but who knows,  no one told us where to sit because everyone was too busy.  Bathrooms are outside Ahmed or was in the high 30s when we'r visited,  and rainy,  so was not fond of having to walk out to UAE the potty.  Overall,  we would choose to try a different restaurant if we had a choice but wouldn't cry if we were forced to eat there.

pPtN49R_kaQpl1crhzub3Q.text: We hadn't been here in years and yes, it's still delicious. Sat on the patio with the heaters...perfect. Bowl of pasta (angel hair) with meat sauce. Shared a thin crust pie. Huge portions. Good service. Leftovers for lunch tomorrow. Yummm.

t2PTgL53QMRmZ9t8pAT3iQ.text: Folks if you're reading this, come only if you're super hungry as the portions are HUGE. Came here today for a Sunday lunch and wasn't prepared for how big these portions were going to be. Place wasn't slammed for lunch as it was after 2PM but there were about a dozen diners eating and only one waitress in our area.  Started with a Kale Caesar salad which was very generous in servings. We didn't add the chicken to the salad as we had big pasta dishes coming. The salad was amazing, it was HEARTY, meaning that not only was enough for two people but we had enough to take home for a second helping. The salad was coated nicely with a very light caesar dressing and the kale wasn't crispy nor soggy, it was just right. There was a nice amount of parmesan shavings on it, raisins sprinkled throughout and also tiny circular pieces of friend mozzarella cheese. The whole thing just worked. Absolutely delicious.  After 15 minutes the main entrees came and boy was it large. I already knew that we would be taking a doggie bag as the servings seemed like twice what you would get at an Olive Garden. My hubby ordered Chicken Parmesan and for me the Chicken Garlic Lasagna. My hubby's order came out piping hot and for some reason my lasagna came out lukewarm and the cheese toast cold. That right there was s strike as I have a thing about food being served hot.  So since my lasagna didn't come out steaming hot like my husband's food, I lost interest in eating it. Rather then sending it back, I forked a couple bites and then just wrapped it to go hoping that it would taste good for another meal. As far as my husband's meal he really liked his chicken parmesan dish. I took a bite of his food to get a taste but after one small bite I felt it was too salty.  The experience overall with food quantity was good and service was ok, I believe we'll come back another time to try the pizzas and the lunch specials.

aJbI7kyh9mPGfsLYrD3PsA.text: How could anyone rate this restaurant 4 stars?  Sunday evening takeout and all I can say is blech!  Antipasto salad was huge.  Like pig trough big.  unappealing dressing.  Heavy garlic bread, too greasy to salty.  yuk.  Marinara tastes like commercially prepared garbage.  No finesse, character.  meatball was tolerable if not for the awful sauce. seems like when we arrived four years ago the fare was better.  definitely like pizzas, now can't choke em down.  What have you become Oreganos?  Just good enuf for your audience.  You should be ashamed to serve crap like this.  I've given you guys many chances, complained to manager etc.  My guess is you guys have somehow streamlined the process.  It's backfired for me.  I think, two or three years ago you were better.

8ev6ps4Rcu-Hh8RIE5Kdfw.text: Been coming here for years! Food is great, ambiance is great, and the staff is great! I recommend their slice of pizza lunch deal, trust me, it's a BIG slice! They also have some extreme tasty cocktails, I'm a big fan of the Bellini

ngAvSxV_8je1dvoIvzo2Hg.text: I used to enjoy their food. I have gone 3x and the waitstaff was very disorganized. I had a chciken parmigiana and it was nothing but sauce and some chicken. I asked the waitstaff and they said they would give me a partial refund, because I ate some of it? My kids like their pizookie so it's the only reason to go. The food is disappointing.

0UHaBeN8l1YIfF-oOHVD1w.text: Ordered take out. Horrible experience! Salad had rotten black wilted lettuce throughout and wings were small and dry and they advertise "Super Wings" they should be ashamed! After $85 worth of food we had to dump most of it as being inedible. Upon calling the manager, Victor, he was about as rude and insulting as anyone could be! Are you reading this corporate??? You will personally get a call from us for certain! It was a birthday dinner and we relied on them to step up to the plate so we didn't have to cook. What a waste of money and to be confronted by a manager that should've been empathetic but was an A...... was a final straw in losing a 20+ year customer for life! Way to go Victor and Oregano's. Too bad really.... Drew

IPY0hs5691S_PB-GMDvKCg.text: Nothing really bad about this place!  The Belinis are delicious, salads, pizza and dishes are wonderful.  If I had to say anything bad, it would be that the pizzas are extremely salty.  Other than that, service was great as well!

UWJeK9_YViqoaSMCkoRkwg.text: Was in the mood for Chicago style deep dish pizza. There was about 15 minute wait time on a Thursday evening. Once seated, we were served immediately. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful.  We decided on calamari appetizer. It was on the salty side and didn't have any tentacles, so I was little disappointed. We also ordered Brussel sprouts appetizer. It was seasoned perfectly, slightly over cooked, but loved the flavor. The deep dish pan pizza took 35 minutes to bake, but definitely worth the wait. The crust was cooked perfectly, nice and crunchy. We ordered the 12 inch for 3 adults, but had plenty of leftovers. I would highly recommend.

4m4H72qO0Uczl3C53PfpWg.text: Good deep dish pizza but it takes an hour to make it super slow. I would call ahead at least 45 minutes before you get here If you'r ordering a deep dish.  Not the best ever had but you are in Arizona.

HY7qp0SgX2Gk1GyKDdCJLw.text: Numero one o is our favorite thin crust pizza, always perfect and great for leftovers.  Love this restaurant since the employees are awesome they really seem to love their jobs and they go out of their way to provide the best pizza,salads and service.

343R5QO_AY1DGY0NmLopQw.text: What's with all the flies in this place? Mentioned them to the bartender, and was told "yeah, they like to hang out by this drain". Moved to the other end of the bar...flies there too. Decided not to eat there...too gross. Finished my drink and left.

6Ytm4y41X-CFen9sJnXMFw.text: Not a bad wait on a Wednesday night. Friendly staff and the food was delicious. We had the wings, Italian gold seasoning, and the spoccili pizza, stuffed style. All was delicous, even the kids loved it!! And we topped it off with a dessert pizza cookie, which is a must have!! We will be coming back on our next trip to AZ!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chocolate chip cookie dessert pizza!

qUNIjmKmcLE-PHwvv_5D6A.text: I'm a big fan of pizza and I am always looking for a good inexpensive pizza place and boy did I find one. Has to be the best pizza in the Scottsdale AZ area.

0yffkqorqFpFF9TtzOQ7dQ.text: Came here for a salad after a hike up camelback. We shared the House salad with chicken and Italian dressing. The big salad is definitely enough for two people. It was sooo good!! The chicken is sliced thin and is cooked with spices that make it taste amazing! Everything was fresh, and tasty. Although we ordered the Guaca-Tony, we were not able to get it because they ran out. The delivery food truck was running late. The owner made it alright by giving us a gift card to come back. I wasn't mad, and he definitely didn't have to do that. Some things are out of our control. But I appreciate the wonderful customer service. Thank you. I will definitely be back! I highly recommend this place! I wish I had it back home!

75rtF88Xt4fiV3DmTdWZhw.text: How can Oregano's be receiving an average of four out of five stars, when they serve by far the tastiest variety of Italian, with the best value?!  Pizza=amazing Any entre salad=delicious Big Rig pasta=amazing Italian sausage, meatballs=out of this world Pizzacookie=amazing  One wish, stop showing the old 50's reruns and show anything else.

IEbH6IUDUPWqLI7St1iRMg.text: Consistently excellent salads (Pablo Picazzo) and service plus reasonable prices are a winner in my book. Sometimes there are waiters who are eye candy and that is a nice feature !   Tip: Go early at lunch time...it is a lot less busy than dinner time when you can often expect lines.

XK7qD18WmDDHL9ChvxM5sw.text: This has been our favorite "go to" restaurant, especially since we moved to Paradise Valley 5 minutes away, 15 years ago. The food here is extensive and extremely good. Portions are huge and we can always rely on excellent food. I don't know how they find such nice employees. Almost hard to find anyone not smiling all the time. Just one more thing. My wife and I would like to personally thank the owner, Mark Russell for FINALLY changing the music to a milder Pandora station. For years it's been a continuous loop of the same loud Italian music over and over. We could tell how long we've been here by the song that was playing. All the employees are ecstatic, also. Now our favorite restaurant is PERFECT!!!  Thank you, Mark The Regulars

TpCMkN7V1GvhjY4dPNLZFg.text: Been here way too many times to keep count.  By far our favorite 'go to' place.  Great huge salads at a great price.  The pablo picasso is a meal in itself.  The pizza is awesome, the quacatony is outstanding, and on and on.  Nothing negative to say about this place from the staff to the salad to the pizza cookie!

Tc129_tXFgcNJ8Pre566dg.text: The manager at this restaurant could be one of the most rude individuals I have ever met. The food was cold and low quality. He didn't care and just blamed my table for our standards. I have been coming to Oregano's since their first location on Scottsdale Road, over 20 years. But they have now lost a loyal customer due to one poor manager.

XGisnZJ94uk7xOBoS_uhiQ.text: Must visit if you enjoy a great slice of pizza. Every time I'm in Phoenix I stop by oreganos. I have been to multiple locations and each one is equally delicious and impressive. Fantastic service and great thin crust pizza. And the pizza cookie is DELICIOUS. Even if you aren't hungry you have to get one anyways and stuff yourself. Not a long wait either, but in the past I have found that it gets pretty busy and having a wait time isn't uncommon! The atmosphere is also fun. Fun music and lots too look at. Pass on the appetizers that way you can eat more pizza!  portions are very large for the price. Can't recommend this restaurant enough. Five stars isn't enough!

bbDepHE2FNvJIU3f6NXMSQ.text: We ordered a large pizza for takeout so I can't really comment on the dining experience. But I can safely say the pizza itself is fantastic. This pizza tasted so fresh and full of flavor. The cheese was great quality (real Wisconsin cheese), the sauce had a good level of different flavors, and the chicken was good as well. The crust was thin but crispy and fresh.  Overall, a great pizza with a lot of flavor. I would highly recommend it.

t5tew8d7droVIcH4T4nAww.text: I had driven by Oreganos for years and always meant to go in.  Finally I had dinner there!  I ordered a pizza with sausage, mushrooms and anchovies.  Love anchovies!  Pizza was topped with mozzarella.  So cheesy and good!  Hard to remember a better pizza.  Great for breakfast the next morning.  Wonderful server.  He was attentive and always had a smile.  A very enjoyable evening.

s1Ny2RYnlRYoIxGsFkFtCA.text: We ate her last night and it was awesome as always! I just wanted to say the staff is always exceptional as well. Last night we left our Maui Jim sunglasses on the table and just walked out on accident. Behold or waiter was such a gem, he chased after us to return the sunglasses to us! Seriously, who would do that these days!!? They we men sunglasses and this guy was an fan of the same style of sunglasses. It really struck home to me. If I couHands down the best, really struck home with me. How warm and genuine the staff is. We had the beef spicy salad (not the name of it) and a deep dish mushroom and sausage pizza and finished with a half chocolate chip and macadamia nut pizza cookie with ice cream!! So good! We get it pretty much every single time we visit!!

eqqronRdPgBzfKZ7Kejdbg.text: Location is sort of odd, but customer service and food is as good as any other oreganos. It's pretty cool how they split iit between two buildings with an outdoor seating in between.

Vc-NhzHkMsFGwiJYjq4kAg.text: This place is amazingly delicious.  Their pizza was so flavorful and cooked well.  Their homemade vinaigrette on their salads is awesome.  Service was good.  Will definitely be back.

0XrH5BG_q5Ne5W_7Q4wBDA.text: I usually love coming here and the customer service is always awesome.   However, the last time I went I ordered a large Beefstro salad and a large Pablo Picasso salad for my girlfriend and between the both there was maybe 2 oz of meat.   I would have said something but if you've ever ordered the big beefstro salad or the pablo picasso, you know you have to search throughout the salad leaves for meat and usually you find your fair share. By the time I consumed half the salad, I was too stuffed on iceberg lettuce to care. Same thing with my gf (she got the small salad).  Probably will take a break from this place...

hQq21lncwgM5ZhwXZz21Bw.text: I'm sure I don't have to tell you how delicious the food here is, but I will anyways.  My boyfriend and I chose oreganos as our date night spot tonight and I had the pesto penny bake, which was phenomenal.  However that is not even my reason for writing this review.  I just wanted to mention how great our server, Colleen was.  For some reason I chug water when I am at restaurants and I never even got close to an empty glass, and she was just as friendly as it gets.  Thank you Colleen, you're awesome!

R151NR9vT-W5ZAJhZK2H7A.text: UPDATE: Drumroll.... I am back on the Oregano's bandwagon!! I had a not-so-hot experience a couple months ago that I included in a review update on Yelp. After posting my review, their PR representative promptly reached out to me, apologized and asked us to give Oregano's another shot. She asked for my contact info to send a gift card -- what great, Yelpy etiquette! And when we came back in it was great to be back. The service and food were amazing and I remembered why I became such a huge Oregano's addict in the first place, (mouthwatering food and fun atmosphere).  You know what they say about customers who have an issue: if you show you care and try to make it right they'll be your most satisfied, loyal customers ever in the future. Having said that, Oregano's and I are officially back together. And to quote Peaches and Herb (yup, that's a real band name), we're "reunited and it feels so good," but mostly, tastes SO good. Thanks, Oregano's!!

kSlQfDY_Ce92gM0CNjdQKw.text: My friends had raved about the deep dish pizza at Oregano's so I had to try it.  I ordered it and had it delivered through PostMates.  It came with paper plates, plastic silverware, napkins, and parmesan cheese and crushed red peppers.  When I opened the box the pizza looked incredible!  However, there was one MAJOR problem....the pizza had not been cut.  In normal situations, it wouldn't be a big deal because I could just use my own pizza cutter.  But, I was helping a friend move into his house, and he didn't know where his pizza cutter was.  So, we had to basically use plastic knives to try to cut pieces and pull it apart.  I would have given 5 stars on the pizza, but sending out a deep dish pizza without cutting into slices is just unacceptable.  .

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pizza arrived uncut
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pizza arrived uncut

HUdkianUuWC2oVgWHIoU3w.text: I love this place! I noticed they redid their menu last time I was there and I was very sad to see the shroom boom pasta was gone, but I decided to try the stuffed rigatoni as I had never tried it and wow! It was so delicious and the perfect portion size. The sauce on top was so yummy and not too heavy.   And of course we ordered a pizookie because oreganos has THE BEST PIZOOKIE! I never stray from the classic chocolate chip and it never disappoints. I love that they top it off with extra chocolate chips as well. Ugh I want one right now!!   If you haven't been here, you are truly missing out!

C9rLUakBmcJioBzndEACTQ.text: I love Oregano's so much. It has always been the go-to for our family birthday dinners. Everything about it is amazing, from the decor to the pizza to the pizza cookies!   The restaurant is old-timey Chicago themed, with jazz music wafting through the background, black and white televisions showing old films, and other random memorabilia on display. The tables and walls are decorated with old newspaper headlines, advertisements, and magazine covers. I always like the poster of Charles P. Thompson hanging by the bathroom advertising some 1950s tomato sauce.   And of course, the pizza is pretty good. The pan pizza is a True deep dish style Chicago pizza, but it takes like 30 minutes or more so it's not something for the impatient. I'm not a huge fan of thin crust pizza in general, but if we're too hungry to wait for the pan pizza we'll get thin crust instead and still enjoy it. Now that Lou Malnati's opened in Phoenix I'm less inclined to get the pan pizza at Oregano's.   But aside from all that, my all time favorite thing at Oregano's is the chocolate chip pizza cookie (aka Pizookie but they can't call it that because trademarks). I don't know what they do differently but the pizza cookie is better than anywhere else I've ever had. It's half-baked to the perfect level of doughiness and the chocolate is perfectly rich. I used to live 3 minutes away from the Tempe location and I would legitimately order the pizza cookie for takeout on a weekly basis because I loved it so much.    Some final tips:  - the closest bathroom is in the building on the right when you walk in, so keep that in mind when choosing your seat.  - the salad portions are enormous. Beware.  - get the pizza cookie. It's free if it's your birthday *wink wink*

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pan pizza with basil, tomatoes, and sausage

CrDTdm0spz6brp9xlQJ95w.text: Oregano's will always be a family favorite. You really can't go wrong with any item on their menu. Portions are huge, so come hungry with your family or friends!  Every time I've eaten at Oregano's I've gotten something different. Our family's favorite are the wings, deep dish pizza, salads, cheesy garlic bread, and of course a pizookie to finish off the meal!  During peak hours there can be a long wait for 30 minutes or more, and seating is limited. But it's worth the wait!  I can't recommend Oregano's enough, especially when family is visiting from out of town. There's something on the menu for every, and be sure to share your food!

sltfD8GJ7LT8P3l5UfBqxg.text: This Pizza was our go to place four at least 20 years back when it first opened on scottsdale rd. But the last year something has changed and pizza is just not the same.  My wife likes a certain wine on the menu but they are always out.....SORRY it's just different now and not as good.

hxbWrEb3dA07P_RCIHjJ1A.text: Pretty sure this location is the original. And is my favorite, but only been 2 others here in area. Today lunch of club soda, plain cheesecake, bbq chicken pizza thin crust. Great service sitting in bar area as usual. Nice outside seating but I'm an indoor guy.

GaKpsfzrh3yH_yhoG9D5BQ.text: This was super sweet and such a nice thing to open my bag to!! If only you knew what I have been going through! This honestly made my day and reminded me that kind people DO exist ! Thank you so much ! The Togo girl was super awesome !! My pasta is amazing as always !  The moms baked Mac n cheese is my go to every single time!! I wish I had gotten the Togo girl's name! She even offered me a water while I was waiting and I just felt that was going above and beyond especially for a Togo order. That was True excellent customer service ! I really am impressed!! My heart is touched !! Spreading kindness is just beyond amazing ! She is a really great worker I wish I could have her on my team !!

gkw_wPbDF0KaTdfIM-UOrg.text: Delicious! This is the neatest little restaurant- super unique and cute. I loved the old Chicago theme not to mention the staff was great.

MjzFLmez6o_W_LcBNmbiOg.text: This is a happening place with delicious food and plenty of it.  Their signature pizzas of course are not to be missed.  But don't short change yourself from their pastas and meaty salads.  This place is always busy and the wait can be well over an hour.  But the good thing is you can get a drink while you're waiting outside in the waiting area.  This is the place to come with family and friends, because not only is it a fun place, but you can see the bijillion artifacts displayed everywhere.  Btw their cookie pizza is out of this world...hot cookie and cold ice cream combined...yum

jcN-OAGdQG6OC_m1fIB9Uw.text: It's a tough place to review.   Pasta - Pizza: 2-3 stars, nothing amazing but nothing terrible.   Cookie - 6 stars - this is the reason we come here. It is a great skillet cookie. However, the last two times they said they had a new way of cooking it that takes half as long. Unfortunately the last two times it also didn't taste as good. I can't say whether that is because it was like my 10th time getting it or the new cooking time makes it worse.

9l98VDQvy76Eix3YbP-2DQ.text: This location is about twice as large as the Oregano's as I'm used to going to, so I knew it was going to be busy. Thankfully, I checked in on Yelp to reserve my table, asking for seating for 5 plus a high chair. We were put at a booth that sits 4 adults comfortably and the high chair was in the walkway. I literally ended up standing to eat because it was better than sitting halfway in the booth.   Our server's section was quickly filled in less than 10 minutes. Clearly not a great move by the hostesses. Lindsey (I think that was her name) did her best to provide good service, but the kitchen didn't help at all in this. The kitchen was either understaffed or is way too small to handle a restaurant that size. Our food came out after about 30 minutes, but our salads didn't come out until we were finished with our pastas. I'm not sure why the salads took so long (Caesar and a House). One dish was missing the chicken it was ordered with, and it took about 20 minutes to get a glass of wine.   Considering the mishap with the order and the fact the salads took so long to come out, I would've thought the manager would come to our table to apologize for the mistake. I saw him walking around, but he never once stopped at any of the tables. Not the best in customer service.

oQC3lYtlmPkykbifsZldYA.text: We walked into Oregano's at 9:40, having just flown in. They were kind even though it was close to closing. We ordered the bruschetta and calamari. The bruschetta was huge, an abundant and well seasoned pile of tomatoes punctuated with garlic and balsamic and topped with basil and fresh Parmesan. This was served on long toasts that you piled yourself with the tomatoes. Very good! The calamari was in strips which was new to me. It was tender, fresh and tasty served with a warm marinara. All was good, service was great and the decor is retro cute.

C-zjwKG6xtkzPbyp7EH1DQ.text: The wings, the salads, the pizza, the sweets we should I start! If you like spicy then go with their medium wings, it's pretty spicy and delicious. Pablo Picasso salad is a great choice good for sharing. Don't miss out on ordering the numero one-o pizza with thin crust.  *ATTENTION* do not leave without ordering the Cookie dough, you can do half/half flavor make sure chocolate chip is one of them.  My only problem which could be a plus for most of you, they serve Pepsi products.
